business.headline: ED registers case against Gensol promoters, Puneet Jaggi summoned for questioningSources said the probe agency has invoked provisions under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) following findings of fund diversion and misrepresentation flagged earlier by the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi).

Pay10 becomes first entity to go live on CBUAE's open finance frameworkThe new license gives Pay10 secure, real-time access to consumer bank accounts, enabling seamless third-party financial services. This sets the foundation for broader innovations in areas such as embedded finance, digital identity, and interoperable payment systems.

Kumar Mangalam Birla to receive Lata Deenanath Mangeshkar Award 2025The 57-year-old industrialist, Padma Bhushan awardee and Chairman of the Aditya Birla Group, is being honoured for his pivotal role in shaping India's growth story.

Sensex, Nifty snap 7-day winning streak, HUL falls 4% after Q4 resultsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 315.06 points to 79,801.43 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 82.25 points to settle at 24,246.70.

India hits pause on Indus Waters Treaty: Could this dry up Pakistan's economy?India has suspended the Indus Waters Treaty (IWT). The announcement was made by Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri on Wednesday, a day after a deadly attack in Pahalgam killed several civilians.

Gold vs mutual funds: What should you invest in for better returns?Gold is often seen as a safe investment. When markets are shaky or inflation rises, many investors turn to gold. On the other hand, mutual funds, particularly equity funds, are linked to the stock market. When the market does well, your mutual fund investment can grow faster.

Middle-class stuck in debt trap, says Marcellus Investment's Saurabh MukherjeaUsing data from the Reserve Bank of India, Mukherjea estimates that 5-10% of middle-class households are now stuck in a debt trap.

Want to share UPI with family? Check steps to use BHIM app's UPI CircleUPI Circle is a feature where the main UPI account holder or the primary user can authorise up to five trusted people, i.e., secondary users to make UPI payments using his account.
Gensol says no ED notice received by company, stock continues steep fallGensol share price: The stock fell 5% to hit the lower circuit limit and has fallen over 50% in the last 6 months.

entertainment.headline: Saturday Night Live ends 50th season with Scarlett Johansson and Bad BunnySNL will conclude its 50th season on May 17 with Scarlett Johansson hosting and Bad Bunny performing, wrapping a star-studded final stretch that also includes Quinta Brunson and Walton Goggins.

Keerthy Suresh to reunite with Suriya for Venky Atluri's nextKeerthy Suresh is in talks to star opposite Suriya in the upcoming Telugu film '796CC', to be helmed by Venky Atluri. India Today has learnt that she is yet to sign the deal.

Ryan Reynolds reflects on Green Lantern's failure, pitching 18 projects to DisneyAt the 2025 Time100 Summit, Ryan Reynolds opens up about the lessons from Green Lantern's failure, pitching 18 films to Disney, and teasing a new ensemble project, while celebrating his wife, Blake Lively's, Time100 honour.

You Season 5: Release date, full cast list, streaming details, and what to expectNetflix's 'You' Season 5 drops April 24, bringing Joe Goldberg back to New York for a dramatic final chapter. Get the full cast list, release time, streaming info, and what to expect from the gripping conclusion.

Team of Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar wraps Mumbai schedule, to head to AmritsarThe Madh Island schedule of the much-anticipated film Dhurandhar was wrapped up. The team is now heading to Amritsar for its next phase.

Oprah Winfrey tops Forbes list as richest talk-show host, surpasses Tom CruiseOprah Winfrey has been named the world's richest talk show host by Forbes in April 2025, with a $3 billion net worth. At 71, she ranks 1,219th on the Billionaires List, surpassing top Hollywood stars and proving her media empire's lasting power.

Weak Hero Class 1 recap, ending explained, what to expect from season 2Weak Hero Class 2 returns with Yeon Si-eun ready to confront bullies with a hardened resolve, as new challenges await him in a different school. Ahead of that, here's a quick recap of Weak Hero Class 1 and a look into the stand-out elements of the series.

Srinidhi Shetty on missing out Sita's role to Sai Pallavi in RamayanaNot many are aware that popular South Indian actor Srinidhi Shetty gave a screen test for Nitesh Tiwari's Ramayana. However, she lost it to Sai Pallavi.

Dia Mirza says Kaafir altered her: Taught me the value of being fearlessDia Mirza reveals how her role in 'Kaafir' transformed her perspective on fearlessness and autonomy. The film adaptation of the series offers a fresh chance for audiences to engage with its profound themes.

Imanvi, Prabhas's Fauji co-star, denies links to Pakistani militaryImanvi, Prabhas's co-star in 'Fauji', denies false claims linking her family to the Pakistani military and calls out fake news in a strong Instagram statement.

Malavika Mohanan calls out male actors for pretending to be woke, feminist alliesActor Malavika Mohanan called out male actors who project a facade of feminism and wokeness, only to reveal deeply misogynistic behaviour behind the scenes. She criticised those who wear the mask of being 'woke' while embodying the exact opposite in reality.

Penn Badgley on dating Blake Lively during Gossip Girl: It was a strugglePenn Badgley reflected on his past romance with Gossip Girl co-star Blake Lively and opened up about how portraying a long-term character on screen affected his personal life.

Gangers review: Even Vadivelu's humour can't save Sundar C's outdated filmReleased-Thu Apr 24, 2025Gangers movie review: While director Sundar C says he makes films for the audience, this one feels stuck, somewhere between trying too hard to please and struggling to make us laugh. It's packed with masala tropes but lacks the spark that once made his films click.

Brainless idiot: Bhagyashree slams user questioning Pakistan's role in attackVeteran actor Bhagyashree slammed a social media user who questioned Pakistan's role in the recent Pahalgam terror attack that claimed the lives of 26 tourists.

Arijit Singh's Chennai concert cancelled after Pahalgam attack, refund promisedSinger Arijit Singh's Chennai concert has been cancelled after the tragic Pahalgam incident. The makers shared a statement and promised.

Actor Fahadh Faasil to reunite with Rajinikanth in Jailer 2: ReportMalayalam actor Fahadh Faasil is likely to reunite with Superstar Rajinikanth for director Nelson Dilipkumar's 'Jailer 2'. The two actors earlier worked together in director TJ Gnanavel's 'Vettaiyan'.

Dhanashree Verma to make her acting debut with dance-centric Telugu filmChoreographer Dhanashree Verma is set to make her acting debut with the Telugu film 'Akasam Daati Vastaava.' The upcoming dance-centric movie is backed by Dil Raju.

Composer Anirudh pauses Bengaluru concert ticket sales after Pahalgam attackComposer Anirudh Ravichander has halted the ticket sales of his Bengaluru concert in the wake of the Pahalgam terror attack. He mentioned that the new date will be announced soon.

Demi Moore named World's Most Beautiful person of 2025Demi Moore, 'The Substance' actor, has been named the World's Most Beautiful person of 2025 by People Magazine. The 62-year-old Hollywood icon broke age norms as she appeared on the magazine's annual cover, reflecting on beauty, ageing, and self-acceptance.

general news.headline: At all-party meet, government admits to security lapses in Pahalgam: SourcesThe central government, in a closed-door all-party meeting, admitted to security lapses in the recent Pahalgam terror attack, which killed 26 people and injured many others, sources said.

Dear Mr Murtaza…: India writes to Pak, notifies Indus Waters Treaty pauseIn a letter to Pakistan, India said that Islamabad had breached the Indus Waters Treaty conditions by sustained cross-border terrorism targetting Jammu and Kashmir.

Pak pauses Simla accord, shuts airspace for India after Delhi's diplomatic strikeIndia on Wednesday announced a five-pronged diplomatic response to Pakistan, including suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty, following the Pahalgam carnage. Less than 24 hours later, Pakistan announced a series of retaliatory measures.

India revokes Pakistanis' visas, advises citizens to return as it ups offensiveIndia has cancelled all Pakistani visas, including medical ones, in response to the deadly Pahalgam terror attack which took place on April 22, killing as many as 26 people, mostly tourists.

Why Pak army chief Asim Munir is desperate for a mini-war with IndiaIndia's top leadership, including PM Narendra Modi, has vowed a befitting reply over the Pahalgam massacre. Pakistan's role is undeniable, and India has both diplomatic and kinetic options on the table, like after the Uri and Pulwama attacks. This is why Pakistan's army chief, General Asim Munir, might be risking a limited war with India.

BSF jawan in Pakistan custody after accidental border crossing: SourcesConstable PK Singh of the 182nd BSF battalion was detained by Pakistan Rangers after he accidentally crossed the Punjab border. Talks are on between the two forces to secure his safe release.

​Simla Agreement: All about the 1972 pact that shaped India-Pakistan relations​The Simla Agreement, signed in 1972, aimed to establish lasting peace between India and Pakistan post the 1971 war. Recent developments have brought its relevance back into focus.​

Air Force conducts drills simulating attacks on mountain, ground targetsRafale jets roar in the central skies as the Air Force simulates deep-strike ops in 'Exercise Aakraman' amid heightened India-Pakistan tensions following the Pahalgam attack.

How India's suspension of Indus Waters Treaty may cause power crisis in PakIndia's suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty does not bode well for Pakistan's energy sector, which is heavily supported by its various hydropower projects.

Can India turn off Indus tap and leave Pakistan high and dry?The suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty by India is more of a pressure tactic on Pakistan to force it to rein in terror groups and stop infiltration. Here is why India can't stop Indus waters to Pakistan overnight.

Punishment beyond imagination for every terrorist, PM promises after J&K attackPM Modi said the terrorists and conspirators behind the April 22 Pahalgam attack will get punishment beyond their imagination as he sent a strong-worded message from Bihar's Madhubani.

India briefs envoys of select nations on J&K attack as it moves to isolate PakEnvoys of select G20 countries, including China and Canada, were briefed by the MEA on the Pahalgam terror attack that claimed 26 lives.

Act of war: Pak says water lifeline for 240 million as India pauses Indus treatyAs part of its diplomatic retaliation after the deadly Pahalgam terror attack, India has suspended the Indus Waters Treaty. Pakistan has vowed to challenge the move legally.

Toilet decoration is Instagram's new obsession, but experts are flushing it downA few influencers are indulging in toiletscaping – a decor trend where no stone is left unturned to transform the toilet into a mini museum, complete with decorative pieces and cosy touches like plush rugs and furry seat covers

Trade to water: India punishes Pak with diplomatic blitz for Pahalgam horrorIndia's retaliatory measures also included an attempt to isolate Pakistan on the global stage by holding a meeting with top diplomats and envoys following the Pahalgam attack.

Indian broadcasters stop PSL coverage after Pahalgam terror attackIn the aftermath of the horrific terrorist attack in Pahalgam, Kashmir, Indian broadcasters - FanCode and Sony Sports Network have pulled their broadcast of the ongoing Pakistan Super League.

Case against BJP IT cell for Rahul Gandhi post after Pahalgam attackAn FIR has been registered against the BJP IT Cell at the High Grounds Police Station in Bengaluru over a derogatory social media post targeting Congress leader Rahul Gandhi.

With rare switch to English, PM Modi ensures world gets his message on terrorPrime Minister Narendra Modi, who usually uses Hindi and Indian regional languages in his speeches, made a rare switch to English at a rally in Bihar to convey that the perpetrators of the Pahalgam attack won't be spared. His use of English was to ensure that the world didn't miss a word of India's resolve to fight Pakistan-sponsored terrorism.

If Arjun Tendulkar trains under Yuvraj, he will become next Gayle: Yograj SinghFormer India cricketer Yograj Singh recently said that Sachin Tendulkar's son Arjun, has the potential to become the next Chris Gayle if he starts training under Yuvraj Singh.

Rohit Sharma's innings vs SRH had vision, stability and perfect timing: HaydenMatthew Hayden feels that Rohit Sharma's knock against SRH had vision stability and perfect timing as MI cruised to a thumping win on April 23. Rohit continued his fine run of form with another fifty.

Will Barton announces retirement after 11 years in NBAWill Barton, one of the most underrated players in recent NBA history and a staple in Denver Nuggets lore, officially announced his retirement from professional basketball on Wednesday, April 23, 2025.

Watch: Munro accuses Iftikhar of chucking, heated argument followsDrama ensued in the Pakistan Super League on Wednesday when Colin Munro accused Multan Sultan's Iftikhar Ahmad of chucking. Multan captain Mohammad Rizwan then confronted the batter for making accusations about his bowler.

RCB have played three matches at home and have lost all of them so far.

RCB need to assess Chinnaswamy pitch to fix home form: KumbleRoyal Challengers Bengaluru need to assess their pitch better if they want to win at their home ground, said former cricketer Anil Kumble. All of RCB's losses this season have come at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".
